Package com.ac.cst8319.lms.service

Class HoldBookService

java.lang.Object
com.ac.cst8319.lms.service.HoldBookService
public class HoldBookService extends Object
This class places holds on books and manages the wait lists for books
Author:
Ashleigh Eagleson

      Confirming the availability of a book
      Parameters:
      bookCopy - the book copy that has it's availability confirmed
      Returns:
      the book's availability
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the book cannot be found

    • placeHoldOnAvailableBook

      public BookStatus placeHoldOnAvailableBook(BookCopy bookCopy, BookStatus bookStatus, User user, Book book) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Placing hold on an available book
      Parameters:
      bookCopy - the book copy that has a hold placed on it
      bookStatus - the book's availability that will be updated after placing a hold
      user - the user that placed a hold a book
      book - the book that has a hold placed on it
      Returns:
      updated book's availability that was updated after placing a hold
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the book's availability couldn't be updated

    • emailAvailableBookWithHold

      Sending email to the user who placed a hold on an available book
      Parameters:
      user - the user who placed a hold on a book
      book - the book that has a hold on it
      bookCopy - the book copy that the user borrows

    • placeHoldOnUnavailableBook

      public WaitList placeHoldOnUnavailableBook(Book book, User user) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Placing a hold on an unavailable book
      Parameters:
      book - the book that has a hold placed on it
      user - the user that placed a hold on a book
      Returns:
      wait list that is updated after a hold is placed on a book
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the wait list couldn't be updated

    • updateWaitList

      public Map<User,WaitList> updateWaitList(Book book) throws NullPointerException, SQLException
      Updating the wait list after a book was returned
      Parameters:
      book - the book that has its wait list updated
      Returns:
      the wait list that was updated after a book is returned
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the wait list contains no users
      SQLException - if the wait list size is inconsistent with how many users in the wait list moved up one in the wait list

    • subjectNotifyObservers

      public void subjectNotifyObservers(Book book)
      Implementing the observer pattern by notifying all users that the wait list was updated
      Parameters:
      book - the book that is the subject with updating its observers after its wait list is updated

    • subjectRemoveObserver

      public void subjectRemoveObserver(Subject subject)
      Removing the first user in the wait list from being an observer
      Parameters:
